container.name: Pouch
container.text: A cloth or leather pouch can hold up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a component pouch (described earlier in this section).

item.name: Spellbook
item.text:
Essential for wizards, a spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.
Source: Player's Handbook p. 153

item.name: Spell component, 10 gp worth of charcoal, incense, and herbs that must be consumed by fire in a brass brazier
item.text: [Spell Component] - 10 gp worth of charcoal, incense, and herbs that must be consumed by fire in a brass brazier

item.name: Spell component, a short piece of copper wire
item.text: [Spell Component] - a short piece of copper wire

item.name: Spell component, a tiny bell and a piece of fine silver wire
item.text: [Spell Component] - a tiny bell and a piece of fine silver wire

item.name: Spell component, a diamond worth at least 50 gp
item.text: [Spell Component] - a diamond worth at least 50 gp

item.name: Spell component, a white feather or the heart of a hen
item.text: [Spell Component] - a white feather or the heart of a hen

item.name: Spell component, a pearl worth at least 100 gp and an owl feather
item.text: [Spell Component] - a pearl worth at least 100 gp and an owl feather

item.name: Spell component, a grasshopper's hind leg
item.text: [Spell Component] - a grasshopper's hind leg

item.name: Spell component, a piece of cured leather
item.text: [Spell Component] - a piece of cured leather

item.name: Spell component, gold dust worth at least 25 gp
item.text: [Spell Component] - gold dust worth at least 25 gp

item.name: Spell component, specially marked sticks, bones, or similar tokens worth at least 25 gp
item.text: [Spell Component] - specially marked sticks, bones, or similar tokens worth at least 25 gp

item.name: Spell component, an eyelash encased in gum arabic
item.text: [Spell Component] - an eyelash encased in gum arabic

feat.name: Magic Initiate (Wizard)
feat.text:
You learn two wizard cantrips of your choice. In addition, choose one 1st-level wizard spell to learn. Using this feat, you can cast the spell once at its lowest level, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. Your spellcasting ability for these spells is Intelligence.
Source: Player's Handbook, p. 168

item.name: Encumbered
item.text:
The weight of your equipment is more than 5 times your strength score
Source: Custom rule to handle speed reduction

item.name: Heavily Encumbered
item.text:
The weight of your equipment is more than 15 times your strength score
Source: Custom rule to handle speed reduction

item.name: Mage Armor Spell
item.text:
this is the mage armor spell translated into an item for use.
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote - Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Wand of Web
item.text:
This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges to cast the web spell (save DC 15) from it. The wand regains 1d6+1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide p. 212

item.name: Potion of Healing
item.text:
You regain 2d4+2 hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide p. 187

item.name: Dagger +1
item.text:
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.
Finesse: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
Light: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.
Range: A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range shown in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon's normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon's maximum range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. You can't attack a target beyond the weapon's long range.
Thrown: If a weapon has the thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. For example, if you throw a handaxe, you use your Strength, but if you throw a dagger, you can use either your Strength or your Dexterity, since the dagger has the finesse property.
Proficiency: simple, dagger Source: Dungeon Master's Guide p. 213

item.name: Pole (10-foot)
item.text: Source: Player's Handbook p. 150

item.name: Wand of the War Mage, +1
item.text:
While you are holding this wand, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls. In addition, you ignore half cover when making a spell attack.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide p. 212

note.name: House Nes'Bleaton
note.text: Cornel was born into this royal house as the third in line. After his family was slaughtered in the Istar uprising, he became the heir apparent.
